entry.title: Maple Aqueduct • 栴な感じ水路閣

link.title: Maple Aqueduct • 栴な感じ水路閣

entry.content:
The Suirokaku Aqueduct (水路閣) at Nanzen-ji, built in 1889 (明治21) as part of Kyoto's Lake Biwa Water Canal project. I saw lots of water flowing through it today.

The aqueduct runs through through one corner of the temple grounds, and is surrounded by red and green maple trees.

entry.title: North Side of Kyoto Station • 京都駅の北側

link.title: North Side of Kyoto Station • 京都駅の北側

entry.content:
Looking at Kyoto Station from Kyoto Tower this evening. Clockwise fron center: the main entrance, Isetan department store at right, bus stops, taxi line, and the Granvia Hotel at left.

This 1997 building by architect Hiroshi Hara is the fourth incarnation of Kyoto Station, the original station opened in 1877.
